The Right Robot for the Right Job in Healthcare
The Right Robot for the Right Job in Healthcare
Explore essential knowledge and concepts in robotic automation, such as evolutionary history and industry applications (hardware and RPA solutions) relevant to the healthcare context.

The first robot in the medical field emerged in the 1980s, providing surgical assistance through robotic manipulation technology. Since then, both hardware and software robotic technologies have advanced significantly, being utilised not only within operating rooms but also in clinical settings.

This advancement aids healthcare workers by simplifying tasks and enhancing patient care through smoother workflows. Robotic technologies are also employed within research laboratories to automate manual, repetitive, and high-volume tasks, thereby liberating the human workforce to concentrate on more strategic responsibilities and expediting discoveries.

This course aims to equip you with fundamental knowledge of robotics, encompassing both hardware and software aspects. This includes the evolution and future trends of robotics, understanding robot anatomy and performance characteristics, as well as basic concepts in robotic process automation. These foundational principles will play a crucial role in selecting the appropriate robots for specific tasks within healthcare settings.

Additionally, you will be introduced to basic problem-solving methodologies, including identifying inefficiencies, conducting root cause analysis, and creating project charters. These methodologies are fundamental to initiating the implementation of robotic solutions. Throughout the course, hands-on activities will be integrated to provide you with experiential learning opportunities, enhancing your understanding and appreciation of the content covered.
Managers, technology leads, procurement officers, and other healthcare professionals who would be directly engaging with robotic automation/robotic process automation solutions in their line of work
Evolution, Applications, and Future Trends of Robotics
Explore the evolution of robots from a historical perspective, including the various types of robots developed for different types of applications, both in industrial and non-industrial settings
Discover the upcoming trends in the current fourth industrial revolution with a focus on the healthcare setting
Explore the basic components that make up a robotic system, the purpose of each component, and how all these components combined to make a robotic system that can carry out the intended tasks

Explore the possible arrangement of links and joints that will result in robots with different characteristics, as well as the identification of a particular configuration of a robot and its associated performance parameters
Basic Concepts and Applications of Robotic Process Automation (RPA)
Gain an understanding of the basic concept of Robotic Process Automation (RPA) and also explore the common use cases
Gain an appreciation of the design and development methodologies of RPA by learning to use UiPath, a popular RPA software, to create a simple RPA solution
Identify typical inefficiencies and conduct root cause analysis, which will aid in crafting accurate project charters and ultimately arriving at a solution that will truly add value
Selection of the Right Robot for the Right Job in Healthcare
Acquire the knowledge to select the right robot for the right task based on the robot's characteristics and the task requirements in healthcare settings
Asst Provost (Continuous Learning) /A/Prof /Deputy Dir, ARO, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Asst Provost (Continuous Learning) /A/Prof /Deputy Dir, ARO, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Mustafa is an Associate Professor in the Engineering Cluster with Singapore Institute of Technology who specializes in Robotics and Lean Manufacturing. He is also the Deputy Director of SIT’s Applied Research Office, which provides overall strategic research direction as well as overseeing research governance and grant administration. He was previously a Research Scientist at the Singapore Institute of Manufacturing Technology A*STAR, leading a team in industrial robotics initiatives for productivity enhancement in the local manufacturing sector. 

In addition to actively teaching and developing robotics curriculum for both undergraduate and adult learners, he provides consultancy services and actively leads applied research projects to develop robotic automation solutions in various industry sectors such as manufacturing and built environment. He holds a Bachelors in Engineering (Mechanical & Production Engineering with Mechatronics Specialization) and Doctor of Philosophy (Robotics) from the Nanyang Technological University, Singapore.
Senior Professional Officer, Singapore Institute of Technology
Senior Professional Officer, Singapore Institute of Technology

Mr. Chan Nai Tiong holds a Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering and a Master of Technology in Software Engineering from the National University of Singapore. He is a Senior Professional Officer in the Infocomm Technology Cluster at the Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT). He also co-chairs the Applied Research Committee in the Professional Officer Division at SIT. He possesses over 30 years of experience in research and product development within the MedTech, robotics, autonomous systems, and consumer electronics industries.
A Certificate of Attainment will be issued to participants who:
Attend at least 75% of the course
Undertake and pass non-credit bearing assessment during the course
Participants who meet the attendance requirement but do not pass the assessment will receive a Certificate of Participation.
The full fee for this course is S$2,180.00.
Funded under SkillsFuture Mid-Career Enhanced Subsidy (MCES)
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.

Interested in this course for your business or team?
Tailored to your organisation's specific training needs, we can help you design and develop custom courses to grow key talent and build specialist expertise to meet the future demands of work.
Do I need any coding skills for this course?
No programming skills are required for this course.
Do I need any prior engineering knowledge or exposure to robotics?
This course is suitable for healthcare professionals with no robotics background. No prior knowledge or exposure to robotics are required to attend this course.
